alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:50PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Grafton County through 730 PM EDT... At 650 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Danville to Newbury. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Littleton, Bethlehem, Haverhill, Piermont, Lisbon, Bath, Dalton, Benton, Easton, Monroe, Lyman, Landaff, Sugar Hill and Warren. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 122 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
